Dialogs.Dialog: Rinko
▲主人公＊▲. What's your eyesight？
My eyesight？ I don't know...
Well, I can see things without problems. Why are you concerned about my eyesight？
There's a girl in my class who has no interest in guys who don't wear eyeglasses.
That's strange...
And she has an obsession for specific types of eyeglass frames too.
Hmm, if she goes that far, I'll start to admire her.
Well, speaking of weird obsessions, even I'm not in a position to talk.
That's rude. You mean because you have me as your boyfriend？
Eh？ You've never realized it？
Rinko
Earlier, I talked about a girl who is obsessed with guys who wear eyeglasses. Do you remember？
Yeah. People have different kinds of obsessions, huh...？
Not so long ago, a guy from a different class confessed to her. But that was pretty sad...
Don't tell me...
Yeah, that guy didn't wear eyeglasses...
So, she rejected him, right？
Yeah, she told him clearly that she wouldn't date a guy who doesn't wear eyeglasses.
That guy must feel very pitiful then. He was rejected when she didn't even consider his looks or personality.
Right. And because he is a very good-looking guy, it was like a shock for him.
He really can't do anything, so he'd better just give up...
Rinko
I told you about a girl in my class who is obsessed with guys who wear eyeglasses, right？
Yeah, a guy confessed to her but he didn't wear glasses so she rejected him, right？
Actually, there's some development after that.
The guy who was rejected started wearing fashion eyeglasses and approached her again.
Right. If he wears glasses, she should be okay with it, right？
But for her, fashion eyeglasses wouldn't count.
It ended up with her giving that guy a long lecture about "eyeglasses aesthetics."
What should I say...？ He has my condolences...
That girl is really obsessed with eyeglasses. I think she's quite honest to herself...
Well, there are different kinds of people in this world. Yeah.
Don't take it lightly just because it doesn't have anything to do with you.
Ouch.
Rinko
I told you about a girl with eyeglasses obsession, right？
Yeah, there was a guy with fashion eyeglasses who tried to confess to her, but to no success.
Yeah. And here's some follow-up.
Somehow that guy just doesn't want to give up. Now he's trying everything to ruin his eyesight.
Can people do that？
Well, I think he's been trying to watch TV as close as he can and starting to read books in the dark.
And, how's the result？
I don't know. I haven't heard any updates about that yet...
But there is the saying "Love is blind." If he gets nearsightedness, I think he'll get closer.
Huh？ What are you trying to say？
S-Shut up！
Rinko
▲主人公＊▲. Have you ever bought sandwiches from our school's store？
I have not...
So, you've never participated in the fierce competition to buy the sandwiches then.
Ah... I thought that must be fun. I heard that the famous sandwiches would be sold out in 5 minutes after lunch break.
But the distances to the store are different for students in each class, right？
That's why students whose classes are far from the store ask other students to buy sandwiches for them.
I see. Then those students would buy up lots of those famous sandwiches.
I also tried to line up with them once, but I wasn't fast enough.
When it was my turn, most of the sandwiches were gone.
Some people in my class also dashed out of the classroom right when the bell rang.
This would be difficult for girls. Especially those that are short...
Ouch.
Hmph. Next time you say that, it's gonna be a spin kick.
(No, no, no.)
Rinko
We were talking about the sandwiches earlier, right？
The competition is very tough.
The most famous ones are the tonkatsu sandwiches.
They're a little expensive, but the size is big and they're delicious.
Tonkatsu sandwiches, huh？ Pretty standard for a school's meal.
The second most popular ones are the curry fried noodle sandwiches.
The smell of spices in the curry would bring some appetite.
...Well, it's all written in an article by the newspaper club.
I see. So it was based on an article by the newspaper club, huh？ You read something like that too？
Hmm... The article was kind of bad.
Rinko just read it to kill time.
Okay, okay.
Rinko
About the tonkatsu sandwiches.
Ah, that number one most popular sandwich, right？
There are guys who were reselling them.
Reselling！？
Yeah. They sold them and charged an extra 100 yen per piece.
But, the teacher found out and those guys had to write reflection reports.
Hmm... They went that far for these tonkatsu sandwiches... Now, I feel like I also wanna taste them.
Maybe you should take the challenge. If you could buy them, Rinko wouldn't mind eating them with you.
(Are you making me a gofer？)
Rinko
By the way, how about those tonkatsu sandwiches？ Did you take the challenge？
It was too much trouble for what it's worth, so I didn't.
That was probably the right decision.
After all, those tonkatsu sandwiches have bloody history.
Bloody history？
Yeah, until last year, people wouldn't line up to buy these sandwiches. They just created a mob around the shop.
Because people passed out when they tried to get these tonkatsu sandwiches, they had to call an ambulance.
An ambulance...？ Why did people want these tonkatsu sandwiches that much？
They're like evil tonkatsu sandwiches, right？
That's why you should buy them.
(With all we've talked about, how did it end up at "you should buy them"！？)
Rinko
▲主人公＊▲. Do you know the English teacher, Nogami-sensei？
Nogami...？ No, I don't.
She's a female teacher and I think she has this weird vibe.
Weird？ Why？
Hmm. I really can't tell why exactly, but... I think it's her ambiance.
I still can't understand why you think she's weird.
You'll probably understand if you meet her in person, I think.
Lately, people have given her a nickname, "Mystery Nogami."
"Mystery"？ Now I'm getting curious.
Rinko
We were talking about Mystery Nogami, right？
Ah, yeah. The weird teacher, right？
Yeah. And this Nogami is actually in charge of the student counseling room.
Student counseling room？ Ah... The one where students go to when they have problems.
But do students still use that room these days？
It's a popular secret spot, you know.
The student counseling room is a popular spot？ Why？
It seems like this Nogami also does tarot readings.
...A teacher in the student counseling room who uses tarot cards to solve problems...？
Rinko
By the way, my friend had a tarot reading by the Mystery Nogami.
Ah, that student counselor who does tarot card readings...
Yeah, yeah. And my friend was warned about being injured.
Being injured？ That's a pretty vague prediction.
Yeah. My friend didn't care much about it and thought that nothing would happen, but...
A day after that, she sprained her ankle during club practice.
So it was true. That's amazing.
Right？ Rinko wants to get a reading too...
(So now, students don't go there to consult about their problems anymore.)
Rinko
Hehehe... Actually, I got my fortune read.
Don't tell me you got a tarot card reading by the Mystery Nogami.
I did.
But, that's quite unexpected. I thought ▲小早川＊▲ would say that fortune telling is absurd.
...W-Well, that's just Rinko's public image. Rinko isn't really that simple kind of person.
Well, how was your fortune reading？
My love fortune is... Hehe... Perfect.
But she warned me a bit that I'm still in high school and I should only do things in moderation.
That's what a teacher would say, huh？
We must do things in moderation, all right？
O-Okay. I think we're fine for that. Haha...
Rinko
Do you like art class？
Well, I don't really like it, but I don't hate it.
Rinko hates it. Especially, when it's painting class.
Huh？ That's unexpected. I imagine that you'd be good at it.
Don't make such a hasty conclusion. I have to do watercolor painting in my art class. It's depressing.
What do you have to paint？
A landscape, like some trees or buildings.
Is it going well？
Can't you tell by what I've been saying so far？
Sorry.
Hah. I don't want to do this.
(Is she really that bad at it...？)
Rinko
By the way, I've finished a rough sketch of the watercolor painting for my art class.
How did it go？
There are lots of branches and leaves on a tree. That's impossible to draw.
And buildings are difficult as well...
Are you thinking too much？ Just draw them the way you feel.
Guys in my class teased me that my picture was drawn by a grade schooler.
Now I feel like I want to see it.
No. If you look at it, I'm gonna kick you.
(Now she makes me want to see it more.)
Rinko
About the painting for my art class.
Ah, the watercolor one？
In the end, I didn't paint it in time, so I had to work on it as my homework...
It was even more difficult painting it in colors.
Well, it's a watercolor painting, so you have to use colors...
That's why I'm getting very serious about painting it now.
And I just followed what you told me to, to paint it the way I feel.
Well, I don't have to show it to anyone else except my art teacher.
What if I ask you to show it to me, too...？
No way！ You're my boyfriend. That's why I can't allow you to see it.
(Are you that obsessed with it...？)
Rinko
I turned in my art homework...
Ah, that one？ Well, it's the end of your hatred toward painting class, right？
Yeah... I'm happy that it has ended, but...
What's wrong？
Somehow the art teacher got something mixed up and praised Rinko's work.
Did the teacher compare it to grade school kids' drawings？
Urgh. Shut up！
So, it was displayed in front of everyone in class.
It was the most embarrassing moment in Rinko's life！
Isn't it great that your hidden talent is now discovered？
Urgh！
Am I right？
Hah...
Rinko
It's quite standard, but did you know that our school also has the Seven Wonders？
It's very standard for our school to have them. Anyway, what are they？
The ones Rinko's heard of are... The first one is the "Cursed Mirror."
It'd appear near the stairs at night. If you walked close to it, you'd be sucked into it.
Hmm... And then？
And then, there's a ghost named "Sachiko-san" in the girl's restrooms.
I forgot about the rest. Do you know anything other than these？
No. I've never heard about this. I'll try to ask my classmates later.
Well, let us both investigate this and let's share the info.
This will be an interesting way to kill time.
Roger that.
Rinko
By the way, have you investigated the school's Seven Wonders？
Yeah, I've learned about one story.
It's the picture of Beethoven in the music room. At night, it can move.
Again, that's pretty standard. But, why Beethoven？ There are a lot of other musicians.
For that, I don't know. Anyway, did you find out anything new？
There's a staircase which number of steps keeps changing.
If you count the steps and the number turns out to be 13, you will die.
In that case, you can just walk without counting the steps, right？
Well, I kind of expected you'd say that.
I wonder if there's gonna be anything more interesting.
Yeah... How about we continue investigating？
Roger that.
Rinko
Okay. This might be sudden but can you give me a report for the school's Seven Wonders？
Roger that. What I learned this time is about the human body model in the science room that could dance at night.
Eh？ For that one, Rinko heard that it could run, and very fast too.
The story differs from people to people, huh？ And ▲小早川＊▲, did you find out anything new？
Yes. It's the mysterious man in the blue cloak.
He'd appear at midnight on the school building's rooftop and would take away anyone who saw him.
But if there were like 10 eyewitnesses, would he be able to take all 10 of them with him？
Well, that's the reason why there were eyewitnesses who survived and told people this story, right？
Somehow, these Seven Wonders stories are so crappy...
Well, they were made to fool children. That's why.
To think that it's popular among us, high school students are still kids, huh？
But, there's one left to find out. I wonder what it'll be.
It's the last one, so maybe we can expect something good.
(If I say that she's still a kid, she'll kick me for sure. I'd better not.)
Rinko
Did you find out about the school's Seven Wonders？
Yep. It's about the ghost of a defeated warrior that appeared in the school's courtyard.
You must grab some chicken food from the chicken hut, and throw it to the ghost to avoid his attack. I don't know why, though.
Then it's my turn to tell you what I found out.
Wait. Is there still another story？
Yeah. I've learned about the illuminating gingko tree this time.
That would make them 8 stories in total.
Eh？ ...Ah, that's true.
Then maybe it actually is the Eight Wonders？
If we keep investigating, we'll probably find some more.
Yeah, right. So this is what the investigation is all about. It's a little bit enjoyable.
(Just a little bit？)
Rinko
Lately, the teachers did some personal belongings check without warning, right？ They should've stopped it already.
Did they do that in your class too？
Yeah, earlier they checked my class too.
Was it okay？ Did you get anything confiscated？
I usually don't carry anything unnecessary, so it was okay.
It was okay for me as well this time. But earlier, they confiscated my comic books...
Well, the novels were okay, but comic books weren't. I feel some kind of discrimination.
The root of the problem is Japan's education system...
(How come our conversation jumped to this topic...？)
Rinko
Hey. Have you heard？
What？
Earlier, during the personal belongings check, my homeroom teacher, Ooyama, confiscated comic books from a student.
Then it seemed like he read those comic books in the staff room.
He confiscated them from a student but he read them himself？
Yeah. But then he got hooked on it. He asked the comic books' owner to bring him the whole series from volume 1.
Hahaha... There's a saying "The mummy hunter himself becomes a mummy," huh？
Now that he read all of them until the recent volume, he keeps asking "When the next one is gonna come out？"
How about the personal belongings check...？
It still continues.
Rinko
We talked about my homeroom teacher who got hooked on the comic books he confiscated, right？
Yeah, I remembered that.
It was like something had turned on his switch. Now he's started reading a lot of other comics.
Should we say that he doesn't have immunity to comic books, so he can't stop reading them now...？
Yeah. But he doesn't look like the type who would enjoy reading comic books.
Well, how old is your teacher？
Hmm... Around 40, I think.
His comic obsession was awakened when he's 40 years old, huh？
Many students saw him while he was reading comic books at coffee shops. Even Rinko saw him, too.
Hahahaha... I think he's getting serious with it.
Rinko
Hey, hey. Have you heard about this？
What？
My homeroom teacher, Ooyama, assigned students in my class to write short essays about impressions on our favorite comics.
Ah, he's the teacher who got hooked on comic books, right？
Yeah... What do you think？ Rinko has to do some research about comic books later on.
Hahaha... He could use this chance to find some interesting comic books for himself, right？
Yeah. That's a possible reason. If so, isn't this what we called the abuse of authority！？
But if he's this obsessed with comic books, during the personal belongings check, he'd let it slip if he finds them, right？
No, it's the opposite. He'd confiscate them as soon as he saw them so that he could check out the contents.
You seem to be angry. Did something happen？
...He confiscated my CD. When he's so obsessed with comic books, he said that "Girls shouldn't listen to this uncivilized music"！
He just doesn't understand！ Geez！
(I don't know if she's mad because her CD was confiscated or because of the comment the teacher made about her music.)
Rinko
There's a small storage room at the corner of the track and field ground, right？
Yeah. People store some unused P.E. class equipment there.
Lately, a cat has been living there.
Somehow, members of the sports club are feeding it. They even named it Charlotte.
Well, that place doesn't have a door, so it's convenient for a cat to stay in there.
And now the cat's belly is so big. I think it'll give birth to kittens soon.
I see. So it's there because it was looking for a place to give birth.
Yeah, I think so. Students even formed a group called "Let's support Charlotte to give birth."
▲小早川＊▲. Did you join them？
Me？ I'm not the type that likes to go with the crowd.
And it's not people's business to mess with how the cat is going to give birth. It's the cat's territory.
(And why do you become philosophical all of a sudden...？)
Rinko
Hey, hey. Charlotte has given birth to the kittens！
Ah, that cat you mentioned earlier？
And you know... They're so cute！ Like, they're so small and so fluffy.
Somehow I want to scream. Kyaaaaa~~
Well, most kittens are cute anyway.
There are 4 of them and they all are so cute. Ah, geez. Now I want to go see them again.
(She seems unusually pumped up. She must really like them...)
Rinko
▲主人公＊▲. Do you feel lonely？
Why？ Ah, I see. For me, I always have ▲小早川＊▲ by my side...
Don't get it wrong！
Ouch！ Eh？
I'm talking about the kittens！ I'm looking for someone who can take Charlotte's kittens home.
So that's what you meant...
Well, why don't you take one home, then？ I said one, but you can take all 4 if you want.
I live alone, so nobody will be taking care of them when I'm not home.
...I see. I've asked my parents so many times about having some cats at home, but they didn't agree...
(She's quite attached to these kittens, huh...？)
Rinko
I've found someone who's willing to take all 4 of Charlotte's kittens home.
Oh, that's great.
That's good news but somehow, when I think that I'll never see them at school again...
Do you feel lonely？
Well, a little bit. But it would be hard for Charlotte to raise her kittens at the school.
Speaking of which, what do you think about it, ▲小早川＊▲？ I mean, what do you think about raising children？
Hmm, it must be tough. I don't know how to handle kids. Ah, but if they are my kids, they must be very cute, I think.
...When we talk about this, it should be the girlfriend who gets embarrassed, right？
...？ Ah... You idiot！
Rinko
Do you know the school nurse, Miyauchi-sensei？
I don't know much about her, but she's very pretty, right？
...Hmph. That's the only thing on your mind？ You're like an old man！ Oh my.
I only said that she's pretty. Don't treat me like this.
Not only is she pretty, but she is also very kind.
She always treats the student gently. Can't you look at people from the inside？
Okay, okay.
Well, what do you think about her？ Do you like a woman who's so gentle like a mother？
That's not bad, but for me, I prefer... well... someone younger than me...
Hmm, hmm... Someone younger than you？ That is...
Someone like ▲小早川＊▲.
Hmm... Okay. That's fine then.
Rinko
Earlier, we've talked about the school nurse, Miyauchi-sensei, right？
Yeah, that's right.
Many guys have become her fan boys now.
They even feign sick so that they can go to the infirmary.
Well, that's a pretty common trick, I think.
But there were some guys who overused that trick. They ended up being sent to the hospital to have their health check up.
That sounds a little stupid. Anyway, she really cares for the students, right？ That might be one of her charms.
Stupid...？ Did you mean me？
(That's a total misunderstanding...)
Rinko
I might've become the school nurse Yamauchi- sensei's fan.
Why is it？
I thought that she was just like other teachers who only care about my grades and that I follow the school's rules.
Well, that's what the teachers have to care about when they deal with problematic students.
No, once I talked with her, she was quite understanding. Yeah...
▲小早川＊▲, it's rare for you to get attached to a teacher.
I'm not getting attached to her. I was just praising her. Don't get it mixed up.
Yeah, yeah.
But you can acknowledge her as Rinko's ally.
(Which means all other teachers are your enemies, huh？)
Rinko
She's just delusional... That school nurse, Yamauchi.
You don't call her "sensei" now. What happened？
I felt sick so I went to rest at the infirmary. But I got bored, so I listened to my music and then Yamauchi found me.
Did she get angry？
No, the opposite. She said she wouldn't mind that, and she even secretly brought me some snacks and juice...
Isn't that great？
Because she did all those secretly. It wasn't a good thing, was it？
Aaah. There is no such thing as a perfect adult, huh？
(You're very difficult to deal with, ▲小早川＊▲.)
Rinko
Don't you think the principal's speech during the school assembly was too long？
Yeah. I guess that's what everyone thought.
And the way the principal talks really makes people feel sleepy.
Right. It's almost like hypnotism.
Eh？ You really think so？ You're the type that would be easily hypnotized.
Why？
If I say it, you'd get mad, so I'd better not.
I won't get mad. Just tell me.
Because you are... You know！ ...An idiot.
Hey！
You're getting mad！
Rinko
Last time, the principal's speech got extremely long, right？
Each time, he talks about more and more stuff.
But he usually repeats the same thing over and over.
And sometimes he tries to add stupid jokes to his speech.
Yeah. That's the worst part.
Yeah, yeah. Everyone feels too awkward to respond to his jokes.
What was that again？ The pun he used earlier...
"The math teacher was a good dancer. He had algorithm."
Rinko
I've been thinking about a method to keep me awake during the principal's speech.
A method to keep you awake？
We have to use psychic powers.
Like psychokinesis？
Yeah. This is the only way to fight hypnotism, right？
An eye for an eye, huh...？
If we concentrate and think "Hurry and stop it~, hurry and stop it~," maybe it'd get through to him.
But I'll need your cooperation for this.
To use psychic powers？
You know, I was just joking.
Rinko
Didn't you think that the principal's speech was shorter？
Yeah, to think about it...
I didn't think it would work, but...
What do you mean？
Psychic powers！
Did you really do it...？
Well, you never know unless you try.
Maybe concentrating on using psychic powers stopped you from falling asleep.
Then how about we both try it together next time？
Do you want me to try using psychic powers？
If we join forces, I think we might be able to make the speech 5 minutes shorter...
(Should I call this part of her innocent...？)
Rinko
We're gonna have a sports tournament, right？
A sports tournament...？
The one that everyone has to participate in！ I wish I didn't have to join.
It'll be fun.
Rinko isn't suitable for team sports！
If you try it, you'll probably find it fun.
Well, it's too bad that Rinko will catch a cold that day.
(So you already planned to skip it...？)
Rinko
Aaah. The sports tournament is really depressing...
▲小早川＊▲, are you not good at sports？
Not really. That's not the case. I'm pretty fast when it comes to sprinting.
Eh？ Really？ That's unexpected.
I don't hate individual sports.
But, team sports are troublesome. So, pass！
You say things like that again... Anyway, don't skip school. You should attend the event, okay？
What are you, my teacher？ Stop it.
(I can see how she causes trouble for her teacher...)
By the way, what will you play in the sports tournament？
Rinko
Ah, that one...？ Dodgeball.
That's nostalgic. I played it a lot in grade school.
With dodgeball, I can try to get hit early in the game so I can leave.
After that, I can just watch others play.
You should enjoy playing it though...
I won't skip school and I already joined the team. You should at least praise me！
(Well, I think things are developing pretty well...)
How was the sports tournament？
Rinko
I planned to get hit and leave the game early, but I was the last one standing...
So, your plan got messed up, huh...？
Aaah, it was really regrettable！
Eh？
I was the only one left on my team, and the other team's members were cornering me...
Eh！？ So you fought bravely, huh？
I want to do this again！
Somehow, it was fun, right？
Not really. It wasn't that fun. I just didn't want to lose！
(Well, if she had some fun, I think it's okay.)
Rinko
I'll have to make a plush toy in the next home economics class.
Eh？ So you have to do things like that in home economics class, huh？
What should Rinko make？
Do you want me to decide for you？
Well, I'll just use it as a reference.
Let me see... How about a cat？ ▲小早川＊▲ likes cats, right？
A cat...？ Well, I might make that.
Show it to me when you finish, okay？
If it comes out nicely, I can give it to you as a present.
That's nice. I'll be looking forward to it.
How is progress for the plush toy？
Rinko
Everything's going well.
▲小早川＊▲ can sew, too, huh？
What do you mean？ That sounds rude.
I didn't mean to sound rude...
I'm a girl, okay？ I can at least sew some clothes.
I'm happy to hear that.
Hmph. So, you're yearning for a girl like that？
Yeah. But, can you really sew？
I can, perhaps...
(But it seems like your fingers are pricked all over...)
By the way, how was your plush toy that you made during the home economics class？
Rinko
Ah, it's almost complete.
And what did you make in the end？
Mike.
Mike？ So you made a cat, huh？
Well, since you requested it.
After I sew the head, the body and the tail together, it'll be done.
Okay, I'll be looking forward to it！
Eh...？ You'll be looking forward to it？
Well, I...
Hmm...
How's that thing？
Rinko
W-What thing？
The cat plush toy. You said it was almost done, right？
Ah... Did I say that？
Yes, you did. I've been thinking where I should put it.
You'd better forget about it...
Was it a failure... by any chance？
My classmates called it a "mysterious object X."
In that case, it makes me want to see it...
No！ You requested a cat, right？
It didn't come out as a cat, so I won't give it to you. This conversation ends here！
(A mysterious object X？ I'm curious about it...)
▲小早川＊▲, do you have any close friends？
Rinko
Not many. If you ask about someone not in my class, there's a girl called Onodera.
What things do you usually talk about with her？
We share same interest in music, so we talk about the Killer Bambies and stuff like that.
Eh？ Now, I'm relieved.
Why？
I was worried that you might have fewer friends because you always hang out with me.
You don't really have to worry about that. That's something I'll take care of by myself.
Really？ But you have to treasure your friends, okay？
I told you before to not worry about me and don't act so grown up like that.
Okay, I got it.
Rinko
Rinko quarreled with Onodera...
Onodera-san is... your friend we talked about earlier, right...？ What happened？
We planned to shop for CDs together, but Rinko canceled it at the last minute.
And then what？
I was going to e-mail her that I couldn't go, but I didn't send it in the end... She waited for me for an hour.
That was really bad.
That's why we got in a quarrel...
▲小早川＊▲, do you want to reconcile with her？
Not really. I think she doesn't want to reconcile with me...
Is it fine like this？ The longer it takes, the more difficult it is to reconcile, you know？
▲小早川＊▲ should approach her first, all right？ Don't be stubborn.
I'll think about it...
By the way, have you reconciled with Onodera-san？
Rinko
No... I was thinking about talking to her, but I felt like she didn't want to talk to me...
I see... Girls can't resolve it by just exchanging a few punches...
Have you ever done that？
...I don't think people do that in real life, though.
Have you ever quarreled with your friends？
I have. At a time like that, I'd just apologize to my friends frankly.
I see...
▲小早川＊▲, why don't you just be frank, too？ If you give up like this, you'll never be able to reconcile with her.
Okay...
Rinko
Well... Thank you.
For what？
I could reconcile with Onodera. While she was still avoiding me, I approached her bravely and apologized.
Wow！ That's great！
Sort of...
What？ It seems like you have something to say.
